context: Watching a baseball game, but I would like a good comedy recommendation for when the game ends.
You like old school or new school comedies?
How about a couple from both?
One of my favorites is Step Brothers (2008) with Will Farrell. You seen it?
Step Brothers (2008) is one of my all-time favorites. Very funny movie.
What about Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006) is also excellent. John C. Reilly and Will Ferrell are a great comedic duo.
John C. Reilly is a genius. Don't know if you like musicals, but he was awesome in Chicago (2002)
I never saw Chicago (2002). I should add that to my watchlist.
Ocean's 8 (2018) will be out in a few weeks. Really want to see that one.
Is Ocean's 8 (2018) the all female version of that heist series?
Good to know. I liked the original and the remakes.
entity: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
resp: I didn't like Ocean's Twelve (2004) that much. But I liked the rest of them.

context.content: "Her (2013)" is a sci-fi romantic drama directed by Spike Jonze. The story follows a lonely writer who develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need. The main character, Theodore, is portrayed by Joaquin Phoenix, and the voice of the operating system, Samantha, is provided by Scarlett Johansson. The film explores themes of love, loneliness, and the nature of human connection in a technologically advanced world.

Hmm, the storyline of "Her (2013)" sounds interesting, especially the concept of the operating system developing a relationship with the main character. I'm not entirely sure if it has enough humor and entertainment for me, though. Do you have any other recommendations that might fit all my preferred genres?
